description: See how Bowdoin compares to more than 2,000 American colleges.
title: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Bowdoin
title_page: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Bowdoin - The New York Times
text:
Brunswick, Maine
The median family income of a student from Bowdoin is $195,900, and 69% come from the top 20 percent. About 1.1% of students at Bowdoin came from a poor family but became a rich adult.
A new study, based on millions of anonymous tax records, shows that some colleges are even more economically segregated than previously understood, while others are associated with income mobility.
Below, estimates of how Bowdoin compares with its peer schools in economic diversity and student outcomes.
